sub_topic: Calculation of the number of electrons transferred in an electrochemical reaction
message_1: Calculate the number of electrons transferred when 1 mole of magnesium is oxidized to form magnesium ions in an electrochemical cell. The balanced half-reaction is Mg → Mg2+ + 2e-.
message_2:
When 1 mole of magnesium is oxidized to form magnesium ions, the balanced half-reaction is:

Mg → Mg²⁺ + 2e⁻

According to the balanced half-reaction, 1 mole of magnesium (Mg) loses 2 moles of electrons (2e⁻) when it is oxidized to form 1 mole of magnesium ions (Mg²⁺). 

Therefore, the number of electrons transferred when 1 mole of magnesium is oxidized is 2 moles of electrons. Since there are 6.022 x 10²³ particles (atoms, ions, or molecules) in 1 mole, the number of electrons transferred is:

2 moles of electrons × (6.022 x 10²³ electrons/mole) = 1.204 x 10²⁴ electrons
